original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Jan 10 2008]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Jan 12 08]
The patient was seen and examined by myself .
Laboratory values and chest x-ray film were reviewed by myself .
He remains in the Intensive Care Unit and suffers from the following problems :
1. Respiratory failure - The patient is status post laryngectomy and right neck dissection .
He remains on mechanical ventilation .
We tried to wean him yesterday ; however , he did not tolerate that .
Today , he is doing well on pressure support of 10 .
The plan is to wean that to a tracheostomy mask .
The patient had a significant history of COPD , and I am afraid if we do not get him off the ventilatory quickly , we might have difficulty getting him off the ventilator , so we will be a little more aggressive .
I have already gave the instructions to the respiratory therapist to do so .
2. COPD - The patient is on multiple medication for that including theophylline .
We will continue on that , and we will continue on albuterol and Atrovent .
3. DVT prophylaxis - He is on SCDs and also on heparin .
4. GI prophylaxis - He is receiving Pepcid .
I SPENT A TOTAL OF 32 MINUTES ASSESSING , EVALUATING , AND MANAGING MR. **NAME[AAA] .
___________________________________
**NAME[VVV M. CCC] , M.D. , M.P.H.
Dictator :
**NAME[VVV M. CCC] , M.D. , M.P.H.
AHA/cap
D :
**DATE[Jan 12 2008] 13:06:25

**DATE[Jan 12 2008] 13:48:13
